item.title: Timberborn 1.0 Release Date Ends Four Years of Early Access in March
item.content:encoded:
Developer and publisher Mechanistry has revealed the Timberborn 1.0 release date, with the beaver colony sim exiting Early Access in just a few short weeks.

As revealed in a news post on Steam (and an accompanying trailer), Timberborn will get a full release on PC on March 5th, having been in Early Access for well over four years.

The folks behind the game also revealed a brand new trailer that will serve as Timberborn's intro when firing up the 1.0 version, and it unveils a little bit more about the lore behind the city-builder, complete with narration from legendary English actor Shaun Dooley, who also played Yura and Shabriri in Elden Ring.

As noted by Mechanistry in the aforementioned post, Timberborn has come a long way since launching in Early Access back in 2021, having received a number of major updates adding new features like distinct factions, 3D physics, and new maps, plus lots more.

If you're not familiar with Timberborn, it's a colony-building sim that takes place on an Earth ravaged by the worst excesses of mankind. Humans have disappeared, but it's okay; beavers are here to pick up the slack.

You'll guide your colony of beavers through the early stages of building their city, and you'll tend to important management aspects like food production, protection from the elements, and environmental engineering.

You can check out the new Timberborn lore trailer, which should give you a good sense of what kind of world the game takes place in, right here. Take it away, Shaun.

Upon launching into Early Access, Timberborn proved a pretty major success for Mechanistry, attracting over 100,000 sales within the game's first week of release. Here's hoping it can replicate that early interest for the 1.0 release.

Timberborn is available right now on PC via Steam Early Access, and it's getting its 1.0 release on March 5th. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
